identity.short_description: A magnificent 19th-century chateau listed as a Historic Monument in Ile-de-France, just 30 minutes from Paris, offering exclusive use for weddings of up to 340 seated guests with 32 sleeping on-site across elegant rooms and family suites.

address.street: Allee de la Fontaine au Roy

location.landscape_description: 42 hectares of lush parkland and private forest creating a stunning natural sanctuary in the heart of Ile-de-France

history.architectural_style: Belle Epoque chateau designed by Gabriel-Hippolyte Destailleur
historical_families: Duc de Massa (Andre Philippe Alfred Regnier)
history.historical_narrative: At the close of the 19th century, as Paris prepared to unveil the Eiffel Tower, another gem was emerging in Ile-de-France. Between 1876 and 1882, under the direction of architect Gabriel-Hippolyte Destailleur, the estate was entirely redesigned to host the grandest celebrations of the Belle Epoque. Commissioned by the Duke of Massa, grandson of Napoleon I's Minister of Justice, the chateau became a dazzling stage for Parisian high society. The Duke, described as a 'French Gatsby,' was a passionate collector, literary figure, and devoted patron of the arts who welcomed the creme de la creme of Paris to discover magical events. The festivities included lavish dinners, glittering balls, operas performed at the chateau's private theatre, classical concerts played by full orchestras, and fireworks that lit up the night sky.
literary_cultural_associations: Le Figaro (1889) article on the Duke of Massa's receptions

spaces.name: Grand Ballroom
notable_features: tall windows flooding the room with natural light
two monumental fireplaces with classical bas-reliefs
spaces.description: The crown jewel of the chateau, the Grand Ballroom is grandiose and graceful: a breathtaking space meticulously restored to its original splendor that embodies the very essence of French elegance.

spaces.name: Ballroom Terrace
notable_features: at the foot of the chateau's north facade
spaces.description: At the foot of the chateau's north facade, the grand terrace stretches out like an open invitation to celebration, framed by stone balustrades and overlooking the park. The perfect setting for a sunset cocktail.

spaces.name: Red Salon
notable_features: deep red walls with intricate moldings
grand mirror above gray marble fireplace
spaces.description: This salon perfectly embodies the grandeur of French opulence. Every detail speaks of elegance, offering a truly sumptuous setting ideal for cocktail hour or a dessert buffet.

spaces.name: White Salon
notable_features: gilded walls with soft beige tones
spaces.description: A jewel of elegance and refinement, the White Salon is a lavish setting where every detail enhances the beauty of the present moment. Perfect for hosting a cocktail reception, an elegant dinner, or an intimate gathering.

spaces.name: The Library
spaces.description: A flexible, fully adaptable library that can easily be transformed into an additional dining room. Tucked away at the heart of the chateau, this warm, secluded space is ideal for more intimate moments on your wedding day.

spaces.name: Grand Entrance Hall
spaces.description: A majestic arrival setting steeped in history and timeless elegance. The grand hall captivates with its classical grace and architectural grandeur, providing a striking backdrop for couple portraits.

spaces.name: Grand Staircase Landing
spaces.description: A dazzling monumental staircase at the heart of the chateau, setting the stage for majestic moments: the bride's grand entrance, photo sessions, or a cake-cutting ceremony.

spaces.name: Esplanade
notable_features: sweeping views of formal French gardens
spaces.description: The chateau esplanade provides a breathtaking backdrop for outdoor ceremonies. It offers a royal vista of the formal French gardens and is the perfect place for a civil or religious ceremony, cocktail reception, or viewing fireworks launched from the garden.

spaces.name: Park Rotunda
notable_features: elegant stone structure with sculpted columns
spaces.description: Nestled at the heart of the park, the rotunda offers a classic, enchanting setting recalling the architecture of 18th-century French gardens. Perfectly suited for both religious and civil ceremonies.

spaces.name: Pond Terrace
spaces.description: Nestled in a peaceful corner of the grounds, the pond offers a serene, picturesque setting perfect for hosting a ceremony, a next-day brunch, or simply soaking up the sun.

spaces.name: Nighttime Terrace with Smoking Area
notable_features: located at the back of the chateau
spaces.description: Located at the back of the chateau, this outdoor space offers a quiet place to chat and enjoy the stars, with convenient access for guests to reach their cars.

accommodation.mandatory_accommodation_details: Accommodation for 32 guests available depending on the package selected. Included in the Emerald and Diamond packages.
accommodation.bridal_suite_description: An elegant and spacious bridal suite comprising a large bride's lounge (58 sqm), a romantic nuptial bedroom (24 sqm) with an iconic gilded hand-carved Venetian lover's bed, and a private en-suite bathroom. The groom has a separate preparation lounge (29 sqm) with Chesterfield sofas and a 17th-century triptych mirror.
accommodation.preparation_rooms: Two separate preparation lounges: the Bride's Lounge (58 sqm) with grand balcony, soft blue woodwork, gilded chairs, and period furnishings; and the Groom's Lounge (29 sqm) with burgundy leather Chesterfield sofas, royal blue carpet, crystal chandelier, and minister-style desk.

buildings.name: Le Chateau
buildings.description: The main chateau building with guest rooms and family suites located on the second and third floors. Rooms feature period furnishings, crystal chandeliers, and historic decor.

rooms.name: Room 5a + 5b (Family Suite 4/6 people)
rooms.bed_configuration: Room 5b: 1 double bed + 1 convertible sofa; Room 5a: 1 double bed
rooms.bathroom_type: shared bathroom between the two rooms

rooms.name: Room 11a + 11b + 11c (Family Suite 6/8 people)
rooms.bed_configuration: Room 11b: 1 double bed + 1 convertible sofa for 2; Room 11a: 1 double bed; Room 11c: 1 double bed + 1 convertible sofa for 2
rooms.bathroom_type: shared bathroom between the three rooms

accommodation.breakfast_details: Access to the breakfast area included in the Emerald and Diamond packages.
accommodation.partner_hotel: Partnerships with nearby hotels for additional guests

pricing.starting_price_description: Sapphire package: exclusive use of the chateau on your wedding day, access to all reception areas, bridal suite, furniture, sound system and mood lighting, outdoor spaces, separate groom's lounge, catering kitchens, cloakroom, restrooms, parking, and housecleaning after departure.

packages.name: Sapphire (Saphir)
includes: Exclusive use of the chateau on your wedding day
Access to all reception areas: Grand Ballroom, Red Salon, White Salon, Library, Terrace, Grand Entrance Hall
The Bridal Suite with Bride's Lounge and Nuptial Bedroom
Provision of furniture: chairs, tables, sofas
Access to the chateau's outdoor spaces: park, terrace, main esplanade, pond, ceremonial alley, colonnade
Access to catering kitchens, cloakroom, restrooms, and parking
Housecleaning of the venue after departure

packages.name: Emerald (Emeraude)
includes: All features of the Sapphire package
Accommodation for 32 guests in double rooms and family suites
Early access to the ground-floor preparation room

packages.name: Diamond (Diamant)
includes: All features of the Emerald package
Arrival the first day at 10 a.m., Departure the third day at 12 p.m. (8 p.m. on weekdays)
The chateau is exclusively reserved for three days

pricing.rental_period_description: Sapphire: wedding day only. Emerald: wedding day with overnight accommodation. Diamond: three days (arrival day 1 at 10 a.m. to day 3 at 12 p.m., 8 p.m. on weekdays).
price_includes: Bridal Suite with Bride's Lounge and Nuptial Bedroom
All tables and chairs (340 Napoleon chairs, round tables, rectangular tables, cocktail tables, etc.)
Sound system and ambient lighting in all ground-floor reception rooms
Light columns with professional lighting effects
Access to outdoor spaces (park, terrace, esplanade, pond, colonnade)
Catering preparation area with walk-in cooler

catering.brunch_description: Pond terrace available for hosting a next-day brunch. Small semi-equipped catering preparation area located next to the pond terrace.
catering.wedding_cake: Wedding cake artists available through recommended vendor list

ceremony.rain_backup_plan: All outdoor plans can be seamlessly reorganised indoors with equal elegance

amenities.gardens_description: 42 hectares of park and forest grounds featuring manicured lawns, formal French gardens, a colonnade, a pond, an esplanade, a rotunda with marble statue, centuries-old tree-lined driveway, and rare plant species.
notable_trees: centuries-old trees lining the stately driveway

activities.fireworks_details: Fireworks launched from the garden, creating a magical spectacle beneath the illuminated chateau, viewed from the esplanade. Fireworks experts available through recommended vendor list.

av_equipment: speaker system in all ground-floor reception rooms
light columns with professional lighting effects
technical.furniture_details: 340 white Napoleon chairs, 1 wedding head table in 3 parts (center 180x120 cm), 20 round 180 cm tables (10-12 guests), 10 round 150 cm tables (8-10 guests), 10 rectangular 240x76 cm tables (8-10 guests), 10 rectangular 200x70 cm tables (6-8 guests), 5 rectangular 180x70 cm tables (4-6 guests), 7 cocktail tables (120 cm high, 60 cm diameter), 4 low round glass coffee tables, 5 blue velvet sofas, 38 metal outdoor chairs, 9 metal outdoor side tables, 2 infant high chairs, 2 infant cribs.

accessibility.accessibility_details: 5 parking spaces near the Grand Ballroom reserved for guests with limited mobility. Ground-floor restrooms include facilities accessible to people with reduced mobility. Pond restrooms also include handicapped facilities.

parking.parking_type: Immense parking lot behind the chateau, discreetly located to keep cars out of sight in photos and during the ceremony

policies.check_out_time: 12:00 PM the following day (Sapphire/Emerald); 12:00 PM on the third day (Diamond, or 8:00 PM on weekdays)

contact.phone_hours: Monday to Friday 7:30 AM to 7:30 PM, Saturday 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM

wedding_day_details.typical_timeline: Access to the chateau from 10:00 AM. Ceremony in the outdoor spaces (esplanade, lawns, colonnade, pond area, or rotunda). Cocktail reception on the esplanade or terrace. Seated dinner in the Grand Ballroom and reception rooms. Dancing continues until 5:00 AM. Guests staying overnight remain until noon the following day or longer depending on the package.
wedding_day_details.typical_weekend_flow: Sapphire: single-day wedding. Emerald: wedding day with overnight stay. Diamond: three-day experience from day 1 at 10 AM to day 3 at noon.
